New Records: Nikola Jokić recorded a triple-double with 37 points, 18 rebounds, and 15 assists, tying him with Russell Westbrook for the second-most triple-doubles in NBA history and setting a record for the most points, rebounds, and assists in a single game. Jokić also became the first player with a 37+ points, 18+ rebounds, and 15+ assists box score in NBA history. He extended his streak of triple-doubles to four consecutive games, the first player to do so with such high numbers in any four-game span.
Michael Porter Jr. hit a game-winning floater with 6.5 seconds left to lift the Nuggets over the Mavericks, securing their fifth consecutive win.
Key Match Events: The Nuggets and Mavericks had 22 lead changes and 15 ties during the game, making it a highly competitive and thrilling contest.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets extended their winning streak to five games with their victory over the Mavericks.
